title: Mathematics
description: Explore key mathematical concepts including equations, quantities, and measurements for Grade 8 students.

subtopics.title: Linear Equations in One Variable
subtopics.content:
## Linear Equations

A linear equation in one variable is an equation that involves only one variable and the highest power of the variable is 1. Examples: 2x + 5 = 15, 3x - 7 = 11. To solve such equations, isolate the variable on one side by using addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division. Example: 2x + 5 = 15 → 2x = 15 - 5 → 2x = 10 → x = 5.
subtopics.codeExample:
### Practice Questions (Q11-20):
- Solve for x: 2x + 5 = 15
- Solve: 3x - 7 = 11
- Form equations from word problems
- Verify solutions by substitution

### Practice:
- Step-by-step equation solving
- Balance equations using inverse operations
- Apply to real-life scenarios

subtopics.title: Comparing Quantities
subtopics.content:
## Comparing Quantities

Comparing quantities involves finding ratios, percentages, profit and loss, and simple and compound interest. Percentage = (Value / Total value) × 100. Profit or Loss = (Profit or Loss / Cost Price) × 100. Simple Interest: SI = (P × R × T) / 100. Compound Interest: CI = P(1 + R/100)^T - P.
subtopics.codeExample:
### Practice Questions:
- Calculate 20% of 500
- Find profit percentage if CP=400, SP=500
- Compute SI for P=1000, R=5%, T=2 years
- Compare SI and CI

### Practice:
- Solve percentage word problems
- Profit/loss calculations
- Interest computations

subtopics.title: Mensuration
subtopics.content:
## Mensuration

Mensuration deals with the measurement of shapes and figures. It includes perimeter, area, and volume of 2D and 3D figures. Common formulas: Area of rectangle = l × b, Perimeter of rectangle = 2(l + b), Area of circle = πr², Volume of cuboid = l × b × h, Volume of cylinder = πr²h.
subtopics.codeExample:
### Practice Questions:
- Area of rectangle l=10, b=5
- Perimeter of circle r=7
- Volume of cuboid l=4, b=3, h=2
- Surface area applications

### Practice:
- Calculate areas and volumes
- Solve mensuration problems
- Unit conversions
